title: How to Grate Soft Cheese

steps.headline: Place wrapped cheese in the freezer.
steps.description: Only allow the cheese to sit in the freezer for approximately 15 minutes. You want it hardened but not frozen.

steps.headline: Spray a light coat of non-stick cooking spray over the front of the cheese grater.
steps.description: Use only a little bit of spray as you don’t want to overcoat the grater.

steps.headline: Place cheese grater on a plate.
steps.description: Be sure the plate is sitting on a flat, sturdy surface as you may need to put a little bit of muscle into grating the cheese.

steps.headline: Remove cheese from freezer and unwrap.
steps.description: Consider only unwrapping the amount you will need (unless you plan to use the entire piece of cheese).

steps.headline: Grasp cheese with the towel for leverage and grate.
steps.description: Don’t press the cheese too hard against the grater but make smooth, swift motions up and down.
